949b6ff3-daf2-4c75-b91b-b8e1cbda4c4a.description: In order to meet the needs of diverse learners in diverse settngs, teachers must collect at least 50 hours of diversity training. At least 25 hours must come from classroom experiences.
949b6ff3-daf2-4c75-b91b-b8e1cbda4c4a.name: NWC Education Department - Diversity

alignments.name: Iowa code 281--79.15(2)
alignments.description: Teacher candidates develop the ability to identify and meet the needs of all learners, including students from diverse ethnic, racial, and socioeconomic backgrounds

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of at least 50 hours approved by NWC Education Department and successful completion of EDU340CC: Human Relations

a0a6223a-ea8b-4041-82f9-96b6ed772d9f.description: The 7 Habits for Managers is built on the framework of The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People. Each Habit has been uniquely retooled to focus on managing oneself and leading others. Franklin Covey’s The 7 Habits for Managers is an intensive, application-oriented learning experience that focuses on the fundamentals of great leadership and its execution. Give both your new and experienced frontline managers the mindsets, skills, and tools that will help them meet today’s management challenges.
a0a6223a-ea8b-4041-82f9-96b6ed772d9f.name: 7 Habits for Managers - Franklin Covey

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the full 7 Habits for Managers Participant Guide found in the online self-paced course

1e2f5e03-9f41-4c20-aef8-15570ea5b589.description: In recognition of our "Teacher as Servant" motto, teacher candidates must provide evidence of at least 50 hours of service to individuals or communities.
1e2f5e03-9f41-4c20-aef8-15570ea5b589.name: NWC Education Department - Service

badge_template_activities.title: The teacher candidate needs to submit confirmation of 50 hours of service including a reflection on the experience.

14fc756e-3bbb-4c5f-a384-00c79eca2fa0.description: This Franklin Covey course describes the mindsets, skillsets, and toolsets to provide leaders with relevant and practical resources to help them excel in their tough and demanding role in leading a team.
14fc756e-3bbb-4c5f-a384-00c79eca2fa0.name: 6 Critical Practices for Leading a Team

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the full Participant Guide

fab3b699-9fb3-409f-ab39-23096711a021.description: This Franklin Covey course describes the mindsets, skillsets, and toolsets to provide leaders at Security National Bank with relevant and practical resources to help them excel in their tough and demanding role in leading a team.
fab3b699-9fb3-409f-ab39-23096711a021.name: SNB - 6 Critical Practices for Leading a Team

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the full Participant Guidebook and attend every session

96be682d-5a10-47fe-9b98-ece7df7b47c0.description: Unconscious biases are how our brains compensate for overload which can inhibit performance and lead to poor decision-making. Helping your leaders and team members address bias will let them thrive, increasing performance across your entire organization.
96be682d-5a10-47fe-9b98-ece7df7b47c0.name: Unconscious Bias: Understanding Bias to Unleash Potential

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the course participant guide

7f4545e4-466a-477e-aa7a-e1ab096f02c6.description: In order to establish themselves as authority figured in both in and beyond academic settings, teacher candidates must provide evidence of at least 50 hours of leadership training. Leadership training can come from a variety of sources such as attending conferences, etc. or on-campus leadership roles such as D-group, club leadership boards, etc. Non-paid and not required for a class or scholarship.
7f4545e4-466a-477e-aa7a-e1ab096f02c6.name: NWC Education Department - Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: The teacher candidate needs to submit confirmation of 50 hours of leadership including a reflection of the hours completed.

636ac874-7634-47ee-ad8a-75b97394661e.description: The Global Leadership Summit simulcast on Northwestern College's campus, offers two days of rich, high-impact, inspiring sessions for leadership growth. Areas of expertise that faculty explore include: Cultivating Innovation, Building Trust, Maximizing Productivity, Overcoming Fear, Influencing Change, Managing Conflict, Improving Workplace Civility, Casting Vision and so much more!
636ac874-7634-47ee-ad8a-75b97394661e.name: Global Leadership Summit 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated attendance of two days at the event learning from high-impact sessions by faculty including: Craig Groeschel, Shola Richards, Juliet Funt, Malcolm Gladwell, Bianca Jaurez Olthoff, Jerry Lorenzo, General Stanley McChrystal, A.R. Bernard, Dr. Francesca Gino, Richard Montanez, Michelle Poler, Rich Wilkerson Jr., Ibukun Awosika, Dr. Henry Cloud, Jamie Kern Lima, Albert Tate, and more.  Please check-in at the table at the event in-person.
Submit a brief personal reflection of learning from your sessions (written notes/thoughts) to innovation@nwciowa.edu by August 10 in order to receive your digital badge

ea4869c2-4652-4d11-b21d-5ce607f6652f.description: NWC's Compass Center for Career & Calling hosted an Adulting 101 series led by the Franken Fellows. The series will compromise of multiple events throughout the spring 2023 semester on possibly the following topics: (1) adult CPR certification in, (2) apartment renting panel and Q&A, the basics of leases, rental insurance, etc. , (3) networking in collaboration with the Business Club, (4) Car Maintenance Basics, (5) Post college finance, or (6) Dressing professionally
ea4869c2-4652-4d11-b21d-5ce607f6652f.name: Adulting 101: Preparing for Life After College

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all three sessions, participation/demonstration, and submission of payment

skills.name: Practical elements of life after college

caf8a296-9b16-4886-adac-872160d40655.description: In order to serve the greater community, teacher candidates must provide evidence of at least 50 hours of tutoring, either in or beyond the traditional classroom.
caf8a296-9b16-4886-adac-872160d40655.name: NWC Education Department - Tutoring

badge_template_activities.title: The teacher candidate needs to submit confirmation of 50 hours of tutoring including a reflection on the experience.

c475bc6e-b58f-480d-9388-3e09cdf10a7f.description: The MindSet Leadership Series is a program for executives, directors, and key decision-makers covering content on leadership and culture, recruitment and selection, building stars, instilling pride and ownership, compensation, decision making, mastering conflict, dealing with problem employees, and team chemistry. Northwestern College's Center for Innovation & Leadership is a standout partner with MindSet.
c475bc6e-b58f-480d-9388-3e09cdf10a7f.name: The MindSet Leadership Series - Omaha

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at the Mindset Leadership Series conference held in Omaha, Nebraska. Earners will have engaged with three professional speakers and other participants to gain knowledge, apply knowledge, and leave ready to engage back into their organizations.

1f799a41-c307-4ab9-aa91-ba8204d52729.description: Helps leaders increase employee engagement and provides tools and processes to continuously improve customer experiences. Most valuable for organizations that seek to create a culture of loyalty with employees and customers.
1f799a41-c307-4ab9-aa91-ba8204d52729.name: Leading Customer Loyalty

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the online course Participant Guide.

fe53d425-6a55-49e6-9ec0-1f07cb765126.description: In celebration and recognition of contributions to the visual or performative arts, teacher candidates must provide evidence of at least 50 hours of arts training and/or application.
fe53d425-6a55-49e6-9ec0-1f07cb765126.name: NWC Education Department - Arts

badge_template_activities.title: The teacher candidate needs to submit confirmation of 50 hours of arts including a reflection on the experience.

092e92c0-5610-402d-915d-93c1ee64e7e0.description: In order to prepare themselves for the professional demands of education, teacher candidates must provide evidence of at least 50 hours of professionalism training.
092e92c0-5610-402d-915d-93c1ee64e7e0.name: NWC Education Department - Professionalism

badge_template_activities.title: The teacher candidate needs to submit confirmation of 50 hours of professionalism including a reflection on the experience.

63f814d1-78b1-4921-b548-51bf29bfcc78.description: In celebration and recognition of contributions to Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math, teacher candidates must provide evidence of at least 50 hours of STEM training and/or application.
63f814d1-78b1-4921-b548-51bf29bfcc78.name: NWC Education Department - STEM

badge_template_activities.title: The teacher candidate needs to submit confirmation of 50 hours of STEM including a reflection on the experience.

00ebc071-2027-45f5-a4c0-9e3235cbf7eb.description: The 5 Choices to Extraordinary Productivity is not about getting everything done. It is about getting the right things done without burning out. Time management alone isn't enough. This course covers decision management, attention management, and energy management, which will ensure you achieve your business and personal goals.
00ebc071-2027-45f5-a4c0-9e3235cbf7eb.name: The 5 Choices to Extraordinary Productivity

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the online course and Participant Guide.

fc1f2304-9e76-4183-afcc-b31b768ff270.description: The one-day conference offers training for PreK-12 school counselors, administrators, teachers, social workers and educational support staff. Gain a better understanding of the impact of traumatic events and behavior outcomes in students, and learn the most current strategies and tools needed to create a trauma-informed learning environment.
fc1f2304-9e76-4183-afcc-b31b768ff270.name: Trauma Informed Conference 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Register for the conference and micro-credential at nwciowa.edu/events/ed-leadership
Attend the in-person one day conference on the campus of Northwestern College on Thursday, March 31 from 8:30 a.m. to 3:15 p.m.
Complete a reflection log of session presentations and submit them via e-mail to online@nwciowa.edu by April 4, 2022

skills.name: Collaborative planning for students with mental health issues
Strategies to create trauma-informed learning environment

ad176b4a-5678-4f24-a0c7-24b3855190b1.description: This one-day program is designed for teachers and pre-service teachers in grades 4-12 to incorporate global economic concepts into their classes. Topics addressed include: standards of living, economic institutions, reasons for trade, trade barriers, exchange rate determination, impact of trade, and trade alliances. Teachers gain exciting case studies and simulations that can be adapted for classroom use. In addition both continuing education and graduate credit are available.
ad176b4a-5678-4f24-a0c7-24b3855190b1.name: Economics for Educators Workshop 2023

alignments.name: Connects well to multiple Iowa Social Studies Standards in Economics
alignments.description: Full details of each grade level and standards matching economic concepts can be found here https://educateiowa.gov/sites/default/files/documents/k-12_socialstudies_508.pdf

badge_template_activities.title: Attend full day event and participate in discussions

e04e3c9c-24c3-4d70-9a9c-5a062d61a60c.description: The Leadership in Education Conference is one day, packed with actionable concepts for teaching and leading collaboratively. Effective education leaders are collaborative in their approach to leading and teaching. Take away fresh insight, practical strategies, and meaningful inspiration. When you invest in your leadership skills, you maximize your impact, bring out the best in others and transform education. Registration for the conference is available at: www.nwciowa.edu/events/ed-leadership.
e04e3c9c-24c3-4d70-9a9c-5a062d61a60c.name: Leadership in Education Conference 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Register for conference attendance at nwciowa.edu/events/ed-leadership
Attend the in-person one day conference on the campus of Northwestern College on October 19, 2021
Complete a reflection log of session presentations and submit them via e-mail to carrie.thonstad@nwciowa.edu by October 22, 2021

e3c495e1-8ef6-42c1-abe8-96e2c3e1dcef.description: Micro-credential designed for Northwestern College undergraduate students that hope to teach in a private, Christian school. This content confirms both foundational knowledge and the required pedagogical skills to teach Bible and religion in the K-12 classroom.
e3c495e1-8ef6-42c1-abe8-96e2c3e1dcef.name: Teaching Bible & Religion

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the following Northwestern College courses: BTS150, BTS250, CEY215, and CEY320.

7c588ce4-a58d-44a8-9d55-f2d85ad030ac.description: The MindSet Leadership Program is an online, self-study program. It has 56 videos organized around Seven Principles of Leadership including a downloadable study guide. Content topics include focus on mission, culture, employee management and development, conflict management, and finding joy. Leaders will develop insights and skills with access to the online materials for one year.
7c588ce4-a58d-44a8-9d55-f2d85ad030ac.name: The MindSet Leadership Series - Online

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a brief program survey at the end of the online program. E-mail the link of your feedback survey results to innovation@nwciowa.edu as proof of completing the program.

fc6ca768-2c8f-4a09-bb40-46d1699947d0.description: The Unseen Conference is a Christian women's conference held in Sioux Center, IA on October 29 & 30, 2021. We had our first ever conference in the fall of 2020. The mission is to encourage women to delight in the eternal promises found and God's word and apply them to our lives as we serve in our homes, churches, workplaces, communities, schools, and relationships. In addition to the micro-credential, a conference ticket must be purchased separately at www.unseenconference.com
fc6ca768-2c8f-4a09-bb40-46d1699947d0.name: Unseen Conference 2021

badge_template_activities.title: A conference ticket must be purchased separately at www.unseenconference.com
Sign-in at the event registration table both Friday night and Saturday morning to show attendance.

A written personal reflection will be emailed to innovation@nwciowa.edu after the event to share your learning from the event. Please write about your experience at the conference and the impact an eternal perspective has on your life and faith including in what way(s) you can apply it to your daily life and future work.

skills.name: Serving Homes Churches Workplaces Communities Schools And Relationships
